intro: Aurota, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting green or red throat. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Aurota thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
